module.title: Should nouns governed by a progressive verbal noun be in the genitive or nominative case?
Am bu chòir ainmean a bhith air an sèimheachadh anns an tuiseal ghinideach?
module.p: In traditional Gaelic, the object of a transitive verb in the progressive was generally in the genitive case eg.
However, nowadays there is a noticable tendency to use the nominative for at least some of these uses eg.
The recommended neutral usage in contemporary Gaelic is to use the nominative with an indefinite singular noun and the genitive otherwise ie.
